conclusion: Plan to analyze image layout and flow of liquid through baffles to determine which container liquid will flow into.
Image shows three outlets labeled A, B, and C at the top and two containers labeled D and E below, positioned horizontally with D on the left and E on the right.
Identify the outlets: A, B, and C are located at the top of the image.
Determine the flow path: The liquid will flow from A, B, and C through baffles.
Examine the container positions: Container D is on the left, and container E is on the right.
Consider the flow direction: The liquid will flow horizontally from the outlets.
Determine which container is closer: Since the liquid flows from left to right, container D is closer to the outlets A, B, and C.
Conclude the most likely container: Based on the layout, the liquid is more likely to flow into container D.
